segment.source: Examples of Virtual Machine Configurations
segment.target: Examples of Virtual Machine Configurations

segment.source: Examples of Virtual Machine Configurations
segment.target: Examples of Virtual Machine Configurations

segment.source: Examples of Virtual Machine Configurations
segment.target: Examples of Virtual Machine Configurations

segment.source: The following are examples of typical virtual machine configurations: one in a persistent MED-V workspace and one in a revertible MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The following are examples of typical virtual machine configurations: one in a persistent MED-V workspace and one in a revertible MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: These examples are not intended for use in all environments.
segment.target: These examples are not intended for use in all environments.

segment.source: Adjust the configuration according to your environment.
segment.target: Adjust the configuration according to your environment.

segment.source: To configure a typical domain setup in a persistent MED-V workspace
segment.target: To configure a typical domain setup in a persistent MED-V workspace

segment.source: Configure Sysprep on the base image to create a unique SID.
segment.target: Configure Sysprep on the base image to create a unique SID.

segment.source: For more information, see Creating a Virtual PC Image for MED-V.
segment.target: For more information, see Creating a Virtual PC Image for MED-V.

segment.source: On the VM Setup tab, select the Run VM Setup check box.
segment.target: On the VM Setup tab, select the Run VM Setup check box.

segment.source: In the VM Computer Name Pattern section, configure the pattern for the machine image name.
segment.target: In the VM Computer Name Pattern section, configure the pattern for the machine image name.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties.

segment.source: Click Script Editor, and in the VM Setup Script Editor dialog box, configure the following actions:
segment.target: Click Script Editor, and in the VM Setup Script Editor dialog box, configure the following actions:

segment.source: Rename Computer
segment.target: Rename Computer

segment.source: Restart Windows
segment.target: Restart Windows

segment.source: Check Connectivity
segment.target: Check Connectivity

segment.source: Join Domain
segment.target: Join Domain

segment.source: Disable Auto-Logon
segment.target: Disable Auto-Logon

segment.source: For more information, see How to Set Up Script Actions.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Set Up Script Actions.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, click Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, click Commit.

segment.source: To configure a typical setup in a revertible workspace
segment.target: To configure a typical setup in a revertible workspace

segment.source: On the VM Setup tab, select the Rename the VM based on the computer name pattern check box.
segment.target: On the VM Setup tab, select the Rename the VM based on the computer name pattern check box.

segment.source: In the VM Computer Name Pattern section, configure the pattern for the machine image name.
segment.target: In the VM Computer Name Pattern section, configure the pattern for the machine image name.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, click Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, click Commit.

segment.target: Related topics
